org.jetel.util.file

Interface CustomPathResolver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HadoopPathResolver, SMBPathResolver

    public interface CustomPathResolver
    This class is intended to be implemented by third party applications. An implementation of this interface can be passed to FileUtils class via addCustomPathResolver() method. Then all external resources are loaded through this resolver: external metadata, external connections, input/output data files (fileURL attribute), imported CTL libraries, ... If null is returned the default clover implementation is used.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.io.InputStream getInputStream(java.net.URL contextURL, java.lang.String input)
      Method should return input stream corresponding to given relative path and home directory specified in contextURL attribute.
      java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream(java.net.URL contextURL, java.lang.String output, boolean appendData, int compressLevel)
      Method should return output stream corresponding to given relative path and home directory specified in contextURL attribute.
      java.net.URL getURL(java.net.URL contextURL, java.lang.String fileURL)
      Method should return URL object with proper URLStreamHandler & URLConnection allowing to process openStream() and openConnection() methods
      boolean handlesURL(java.net.URL contextURL, java.lang.String fileURL)
      Method should return true if this CustomPathResolver handles specified URL - protocol Note that if the method returns true, the resolver must implement both getInputStream(URL, String) and getOutputStream(URL, String, boolean, int).
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> resolveWildcardURL(java.net.URL contextURL, java.lang.String fileURL)
      Method should resolve wildcard URL - i.e. return list of concrete files/URLs

    • Method Detail

      • getInputStream

        java.io.InputStream getInputStream(java.net.URL contextURL,
                                 java.lang.String input)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Method should return input stream corresponding to given relative path and home directory specified in contextURL attribute. If null is returned the other CustomPathResolver implementation are used and finally if none of them has success the default clover implementation is used.
        Parameters:
        contextURL - working/home directory
        input - URL of the source file
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getOutputStream

        java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream(java.net.URL contextURL,
                                   java.lang.String output,
                                   boolean appendData,
                                   int compressLevel)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Method should return output stream corresponding to given relative path and home directory specified in contextURL attribute. If null is returned the other CustomPathResolver implementation are used and finally if none of them has success the default clover implementation is used.
        Parameters:
        contextURL - working/home directory
        output - URL of the target file
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getURL

        java.net.URL getURL(java.net.URL contextURL,
                  java.lang.String fileURL)
                    throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Method should return URL object with proper URLStreamHandler & URLConnection allowing to process openStream() and openConnection() methods
        Parameters:
        contextURL - working/home directory
        input - URL of the source file
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - - thrown when this resolver does not support protocol defined in fileURL

      • handlesURL

        boolean handlesURL(java.net.URL contextURL,
                 java.lang.String fileURL)
        Method should return true if this CustomPathResolver handles specified URL - protocol

        Note that if the method returns true, the resolver must implement both getInputStream(URL, String) and getOutputStream(URL, String, boolean, int).

        Parameters:
        contextURL - working/home directory
        fileURL - URL of the source file
        Returns:

      • resolveWildcardURL

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> resolveWildcardURL(java.net.URL contextURL,
                                                  java.lang.String fileURL)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Method should resolve wildcard URL - i.e. return list of concrete files/URLs
        Parameters:
        contextURL - working/home directory
        fileURL -
        Returns:
        list of resolved filenames
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the the wildcard can't be resolved for whatever reason
